description: 1956 Chevrolet 3100 Pickup

This stunning big back window stepside truck was the recipient of a high dollar frame off restoration in 2004, everything is new or rebuilt. It has remained in a private collection since, and has only been driven 100 pampered miles to nearby car shows. The two-tone tropical turquoise/white paint finish remains in show quality condition today as does the matching vinyl two-tone upholstery. A 235 cubic inch six cylinder engine with twin carbs on an Offenhauser aluminum intake and Fenton cast iron headers with dual exhaust and a column shift three speed manual transmission are barely broke in since rebuild. A deluxe heater, wall to wall carpet with custom carpet floor mats, custom indash AM/FM stereo radio, radial wide white wall tires and exterior sunvisor are just some of the niceties added to desirable pickup…  PRICE $ 65,000.00 USD

This really nice 1956 Chevy Pickup is in great shape and runs as good as it looks. It has been modernized to make it a really great driving truck. It comes with 350V8, AC, power steering, power disc brakes, power windows, power split bench seat, 20in wheels, dual mirrors, tilt wheel, custom interior with custom gauges, 16 gal fuel cell, big back window, Chevelle sub frame, sun visors, chrome grill, and much more.
Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1959 Chevy 3100 Apache short bed half ton big window. Restored hot rod. Vintage look with modern conveniences. Commands attention EVERYWHERE!
HISTORY

1959: Minimal changes from 1958, the most apparent was a larger and more ornate hood emblem and redesigned badging on the fenders. The last year that the NAPCO (Northwestern Auto Parts Company) "Powr-Pak" four-wheel drive conversion could be factory ordered. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA

PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU ARE COMFORTABLE WITH THIS BEFORE BUYING A VINTAGE AUTOMOBILE.  Please call a sales expert to get details on these systems 1-877-422-2940.
CLASSIC CAR RESTORATIONS:

The term "restoration" in context to the vintage car world has taken on a definition of its own. For some people, a restoration is simply painting a car and replacing items as needed, while for others, restoration means an extensive disassembly and overhaul, with each piece getting rebuilt or replaced.

As a consumer, it's important to understand the basics of restoration levels for it can impact classic car values substantially. There are hundreds of ways to restore a vintage car or truck including but not limited to the following: i).
Frame off restoration.
Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly. ii).
Rotisserie restoration.

These restorations are when the body (or body and frame on a unibody vehicle) are disassembled and restored utilizing a rotisserie. Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly and iii).
Cosmetic or driver quality restoration.

These restoration are typically limited to cosmetic items including paint and body, interior, trim and emblems, etc. Within the three levels or restoration mentioned above, there can be varying quality from an in the garage / amateur restoration to a high dollar professional concours restoration. There is a universal 100 point grading system rating classic car conditions ranging from 100 being excellent to 20 being unrestorable.
In addition to the levels of restoration above, it's important to understand the type of restoration as well for it can also impact value substantially. Type of restorations include: i).
Factory or stock restoration.

This type of restoration is geared towards restoring the car or truck to stock specs from the factory as if it were new. These types of restorations use original or oem (original equipment manufacturer) where possible. Factory original restorations tend to bring the highest dollars from collectors. ii).
Custom restoration.

These types of restorations are geared towards builder preference over factory stock. These can be refereed to as customs or hot rods. Typically these vehicles will have custom paint work, aftermarket wheels, suspension upgrades, power plant transplants, etc. A specific sector of custom restoration vehicles is pro-touring or restomod / restomods which are custom built with a more modern street performance and creature comforts than the original factory vehicle.
Please note that WWVA is not a restoration shop nor do we restore vehicles to any degree.
For questions on what type or level of restoration of any of our vehicles in inventory please call our vintage sales expert today at 1-877-422-2940.

We provide approximately 75 HD images, and an HD video, in every one of our listings.  Very few companies offer this much detail.  We spend significant time inspecting and disclosing detailed items on all of our vehicles; however, at the end of the day, we are not you... we highly suggest that you come and inspect the vehicle.

The information contained in this ad is solely for convenience.  The description is an opinion only and should not be considered a complete description of any or all faults; it may not be relied upon nor taken as fact or otherwise a representation or warranty of any sort.  Please note, we did NOT build or restore the vehicle. Vehicles are sold AS-IS, WHERE-IS with all faults known/unknown and with no implied warranty.  Unless shown in the photographs, we do NOT have documentation, receipts, or photographs of the vehicle listed.

We do not recommend driving a classic car home. Many classic cars are not driven often and tend to sit for long periods of time making them unsuitable for cross-country road trips. We strongly recommend shipping the vehicle.

We sell our vehicles mileage-exempt, meaning we do not know the actual, original miles. The information listed in the ad is based on the current odometer reading or from rebuild information provided by the builder, and cannot be used as fact.
Most of these vehicles do not have Carfax or Autocheck history reports; unless the vehicle is 1981 or newer, a Carfax or Autocheck history will not exist.

Welcome to StreetDreamsTexas as we celebrate our 18th year in the classic and muscle car business. General Motors, and Chevrolet in particular, had three of the best years in their history from 1955 to 1957. GM's passenger car styling set a post-war high water mark that is still written about today, and their trucks benefitted as well. With their hooded headlights and wraparound windshields, these trucks became instant classics that remain wildly popular today the world over. This sharp-looking Pinecrest Green '56 Chevy 3100 showcases this styling nicely, with good paint, chrome, and glass. She's powered by a Chevy 350 sporting a GM aluminum intake manifold, headers, and HEI and the finned valve covers and matching air cleaner for the old school look. Other tasteful upgrades include a 700R4 automatic overdrive transmission, Mustang II front clip with rack and pinion steering, tubular A-arms,  Vintage Air air conditioning, power steering, Autometer and Sunpro gauges, a banjo steering wheel, stereo, and billet handles for windows and doors.  She features brand new 16 inch wide white wall radials on steelies.  The bed is all custom stained to look 100 years old.  Great truck here to enjoy. This is an attractive, fun, and practical machine that's also a milestone for post-war American styling. Street Dreams is a full service dealership that can assist with worldwide delivery, insurance, and financing options.

This Custom built 1956 Chevy 3100 just came out of a full frame off restoration here at Velocity Restorations. Here at Velocity Restorations we pride ourselves in customer satisfaction and attention to detail. Our attention to detail is second to none and it shows. All of our restorations are done 100% in our shop with over 600 pictures of the build from beginning to end. We do not farm out any of our restoration to another company, we do everything by hand in our quality controlled environment. How can you control quality if you are not personally going over every inch of the build every day from the beginning of the build until she ships? You cant and that is what sets us apart. Our facility is over 18,000sqft with 14 full time employees.

This 1956 Chevrolet 3100 is equipped with a 400 HP LS1 with 4L60E transmission. We have fabricated in a custom Impala dash in place of the old school plain dash. We have also hand built the center console -roll pan and Cadillac lights. We 4 linked the rear end and installed full Ride Tech Air ride all the way around. The interior is a Custom Lipstick Red Leather hand sewn around our custom built seats and interior. The windows are power one piece window instead of the manual crank with the leaky vent windows. The Impala dash is outfitted with Dakota Digital gauges. The list just goes on with this truck and you just have to see it in person.

Please call us at Velocity Restorations and we can go over everything that this build comes with or we can discuss a custom build for you that fits your needs. We are the leader in vintage car restorations and we encourage you to come see us and let us get you into the classic you have always wanted.

Truck is also known as "AMEN". 454 cui / 409 HP Big Block Chevy with Cary Comb ported & polished heads, Mahle 9.5:1 pistons, and Comp Cam camshaft. TH400 with a 2,000 stall converter. Ford 9" rear end. Custom Two-tone PPG Ultra Silver / Silver Green / Flame exterior finish. Custom Leather bench seat interior with complemented Ostrich skin. Power 4 wheel CPP disc brakes. Power Rack & Pinion steering. Vintage Air A/C. Triangulated 4 link rear set-up. AirRide Technologies ShockWaves Airbags. '77 Firebird front clip. 25 gallon stainless fuel tank re-routed under the bed. Chassis boxed, smoothed, and powder-coated. Painted tilt column. Power windows. Custom fitted door handles. Aftermarket gauges with AMEN inscribed. Eclipse AM/FM/CD stereo with Bazooka amp & speakers. Truely one of a kind custom build with filled body seams, welded tailgate, cut & reshaped the four bedposts, made rear roll apn, custom center-located stainless-steel exhaust tip, custom chrome-plated wire mesh grille (also incorporated on interior dash & hood), pie cutting the hood, one-off door handles (custom fitted), shaved drip rails, and LED rear taillights along with custom fitted 3rd brake light in top of cab. The engine bay was slicked / smoothed / painted to match. The bed of truck was finished in Aluminum and hand crafted specially for the truck. Custom made engine cover with Airbrush "AMEN". 18" Front 20" Rear Boyd Coddington wheels. Total Kaos Designs in Pasadena, TX was where most of the restoration occurred along with finishing designs through-out some smaller shops, in total of 9 complete shops in the build. Featured in Hotrod.com and Classic Trucks this one-of the kind build took nearly 9 years in the making to build. With numerous amount of money made to build this dream truck. Call (830) 629-4843 for more information on this or any 1957 Chevrolet Pickup for sale in our inventory. Striking, custom, and affordable – this 1957 Chevrolet 3100 pickup is everything you want in a vintage and attention-grabbing pickup, right down to the small block V8 under the hood.

The person who made this custom creation was probably a University of Tennessee fan, but you don't have to support the Vols to appreciate the exceptional artistry.  After all, the way the orange blends into the white takes a very professional hand.  Up front we love how the orange is used to patina the grille and highlight the power domes of the hood.  It uses the naturel lines of the profile to help divide the two colors on the sides, and then takes its time on tailgate to really show you what a cool fade can be.  It's all quite creative.  Even the real wood truck bed gets in the two-tone action with orange securing rails within the white-walled bed.

Inside is more custom two tone.  There was a nice investment in a custom vinyl bench seat, and this is the only place that officially declares its love for the Vols.  And the way the door panels, dash, roof, and steering column all intertwine with orange and white is downright attractive.  This truck comes with all the right features that you would install yourself.  This ranges from the B&M floor shifter, to retro-style AM/FM stereo that can adapt to more modern music players.  You get an upgraded sports steering wheel, and beyond that is the classic fan-style Chevy speedometer.  And while that looks great in this '57, the trio of auxiliary gauges is quite handy to keep you in touch with what's going on under the hood.

The orange engine bay has been upgraded with small block power.  The 305 cubic-inch V8 looks nicely dressed with Edelbrock air topper and valve covers.  But more importantly, Edelbrock also provided the performance four-barrel carburetor.  Not only does this V8 inhale deeply, but also it exhales with authority as the performance headers that feed a newer stainless glasspack-style dual exhaust.  You get the best control over this enhanced V8's powerband thanks to an adjustable stall converter on the three-speed automatic transmission.  On the road, you're going to love how this classic feels with upgrades such as the Mustang II-style independent front suspension, power steering, and front disc brakes.  This modern cruising package is finished off with large 18-inch OE Racing alloys with grippy Falken tires at each corner.
This truck will impress you with its quality and custom work.  So the value price is just the cherry on top.  A deal like this is always goes quickly, so call today!

This breathe taking 1956 3100 fleetside pickup has an intense restoration story to tell.  It began in 1956 where it came from the factory with a 265 v8 with a 4 speed and it was dark green and was radio delete.  It was rescued in a barn in 2012 and made its way to Alabama.  The truck was nearly rust free to begin with and the original cab, fenders, rocker panels, interior floor and hood were used.  The owner adder the spears from a 1957 hood because he liked the look of them.  The entire truck was torn apart and dismantled and then sandblasted and prepared for paint.  It was put in primer and block sanded numerous times.  After much consideration a power plant was chosen.  The truck was fitted with an LS1 5.7L Corvette engine and pulls about 350 HP with a 4L60E computer controlled transmission.  Up next for attention was the frame.  It was given a TCI suspension and included Mustang 2 rack and pinion, tubular upper and lower control arms, and sway bars with disc brakes.

After the suspension was built and checked to be sure all was square, the chassis was again disassembled and all parts as well as the frame went for powder coating using grey speckled effect.  The stock frame was used and it was boxed.  The factory straight axle was replaced and given a Nova 8.5 rear axle with 342 gears and new leaf springs replaced the original rear end, making the front and rear tracking the same.  The truck was sprayed with many coats of base coat clear coat Guards Red, 1970 Porsche code 027.  The truck was given an aluminum radiator and the battery was relocated.  The bed was finished with red oak stain over oak wood with 7 coats of Spar Marine Clear and shines at a very high gloss.  The strips that separate the oak planks are also wood, doing away with the look of chrome strips.  The truck was given a fuel cell under the bed near the rear.    The interior was finished in white and tan leather and shows very well.  This 3100 was given power windows and given a big back window instead of the small standard glass.  Upon re-assembly it was given vintage air and was installed and all new chrome and lights were used.  A new sound system was installed with a retro radio as well.  There are speakers installed in the kick panels.  It was given Omega gauges as well.  A bed from 1968 was used, which was the first year a fleetside was offered.  The truck has power brakes, power steering and a tilt steering wheel.  The wheels are American Racing 17x7 torque thrust with a 5:43/4 bolt pattern.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

1959 Chevy Apache 3100, Short bed, Step Side. Frame off Restoration/Modification. Frame was blasted then modified to accept a later model Chevrolet V8 Engine, Automatic Transmission, Transfer case, and later model Z71 Close Ratio Power Steering Box. Then the frame was shot with a Sherwin/Williams single Stage, Semi Flat, Catalyzed Black Urethane Paint. Factory Front and Rear Axles were also Swaped out with later model Chevrolet Truck Axles, both of which are equipped with factory disc brakes. 18X9 Aluminum Wheels from GM wearing 255/70/18 Light Truck Radial Tires. GM Goodwrench 350 Four Bolt Main's 260 Horse Power Crate Engine with Iron Heads removed and replaced with a new set of GM Performance Aluminum Angle Plug Heads.Topped with Chevrolet Corvette Center Bolt Valve Covers. Stock Camshaft was pulled and replaced with slightly Hotter Camshaft, also from GM Performance parts. Performer 4 Barrel Edlebrock intake and Carburetor. MSD Ignition Box, Coil, Billet Distributor, and 8.5mm Plug Wires. Sanderson Short Style Headers; Jet coated inside and out. One Serpentine Belt Runs the Power Steering, Hydraboost/Hydraulic Power Brakes, Classic Air Conditioning Compressor, Water Pump. and One Wire Alternator. Griffen Race Aluminum Radiator with Engine Oil Cooler and Twin Electric Fans, all held in place with hand fabricated brackets/mounts and Stainless Steel Hardware. All Fuel Lines, Engine Oil Cooler Lines, Transmission Cooler Lines, Power Steering Lines, and Hydraboost Power Brake Lines are assembled using High Pressure, High Heat Resistant, Black, AN Lines and Fittings.

GM Turbo Hydramatic 400 transmission, Electric Stand Alone Transmission Fluid Cooler Unit. New Process 208 Transfer Case with Two Wheel drive High Range, Four Wheel Drive High Range, Neutral, and Four Wheel Drive Low Range. Chrome Moly Drive Shafts. Front and Rear GM Corporate "10 Bolt" Front Axle with all new Ball Joints, Bearings, Seals, Outer Axle Shaft U-Joints, New 3.73:1 Gears, Factory Chevy 1/2 Ton Front Disk Brakes and an Aftermarket Steering Stabilizer.

GM Corporate "14 Bolt" Semi Float Rear Differential mounted on New Three Quarter Ton Leaf Springs and Using New Auburn Gear Positive Traction Carrier with 3.73:1 Gears, and Factory !/2 Ton Disc Brakes. Late Model Twent One Circuit, GM Truck Wiring Harness. This Wire Harness has extra optional circuits for future upgrades or add ons. Halogen Headlights. LED Parking/Signal, Brake, and in Bumper Reverse Lights. All Glass and Weather strip is New.

Exterior/Interior of TruckBody has been Media Blasted, then Refinished in a Sherwin Williams Catalyzed Enamel GM "Victory Red" and GM "Summit White". Interior Trim Color is a Coarse Sparkling Flake, Base clear coat.

Underside of Cab, inner fenders, underside of bedsteps, underside of rear fenders, and bed walls have been Media Blasted, Primed, and treated with Duraliner Bedliner. Floor of Bed is Five Quarter Rough Sawn Oak treated with Ebony Stain, then two coats of heavy duty Urethane Clear. All held inplace with Stainless Steel Hardware. Front and Rear Bumpers have been modified/smoothed. Rear bumper notched for Exhaust Tip Exit.

Tilt Steering Wheel Column is from Ididit, Classic Auto Air Conditioning and Heat. Intermittent Windshield Wipers/Washers. Custom Built Leather Bench Seat flips forward for under seat storage. Late model style Carpet and Headliner.
Beautiful Truck 1100 miles since completion. Won "best of Show" Lake Tahoe Memorial Weekend 2017.

Marine Corps Vet selling a very nice 56' Chevy "Big Window" in very nice driver condition. New American Autowire wiring harness. New wood bed. New tires.

The truck does have a very smooth running 350 V8 that starts right up and runs strong, it supposedly has about 15k on a rebuild including the TH350 trans and does run like it. The truck has been completely gone through and runs great!
There is an 80's Chevy truck rear end installed that helps the truck run highway speeds with no problems.

If you're in the market for something fun that's guaranteed to hold its appeal for a very long time, it's hard to go wrong with a lust worthy truck! America's favorite mode of transportation is finally commanding the respect it deserves. And with awesome customs like this award-winning 3100 mixing red carpet looks with everyday drivability, it's not hard to see why. A perfect blend of timeless style and proven mechanicals, this supercharged half-ton is a first-rate exercise in old school charm and vintage swagger. And if you're looking for a handsome cruiser that can be enjoyed for years to come, it's the classic of your dreams!
BODYWORK/TRIM

Professionally rehabilitated and customized during a detailed, body-off restoration, this striking 3100 spent most of its life as a California ranch truck. In what amounted to a systematic, high-dollar rebuild, its solid body was completely stripped, tastefully modified and layered in a sweet combination of green fleck and silver fleck 2-stage. And in 2005, the truck debuted as a head turning half-ton that spent the better part of the next decade being showered in accolades like Best Interior, Best Paint, Best Engine and Best Pick-Up!

While its basic shape is certainly appealing, first rate detailing is what makes this Chevy really pop. At the front of the truck, a polished bumper founds a polished grille between frenched parking lamps and chrome-trimmed tri-bar headlights. Behind that grille, a shaved hood leads the eye to smoked glass, which floats between shaved drip rails, chrome-capped wipers and sleek hot rod mirrors. Opposite that roof, a shaved profile centers custom flames between a frenched antenna and low-profile exhaust tips. And at the back of that profile, a smooth tailgate founds a custom tag pocket and a Chevrolet-themed Center High Mount Stop Lamp between an Oak bed, a custom roll pan and slender LED taillights.
ENGINE

Exercise the truck's chrome hood supports and you'll find 350 cubic inches of Chevrolet small block that, thanks to a rowdy Comp cam and polished Weiand 142 supercharger, creates an impressive 515 horsepower! At the top of that fully sorted mill, a Weiand Hi-Tek air cleaner funnels wind in to a coated Holley carburetor, which seats a small Summit pressure gauge between polished and braided fuel lines. Beneath the blower, a polished intake perfectly complements polished and milled valve covers, which hang polished breathers and trick wingnut ties over lightweight Edelbrock Performer heads. Behind those breathers, a modern HEI distributor shoots spark through loomed Taylor Spiro Pro plug wires. At the front of those looms, bright serpentine components spin a polished water pump beneath a polished alternator and polished AC compressor. In front of those ancillaries, a green core support hugs a beefy Be Cool radiator, which plays well with two corrugated hoses, a polished expansion tank and two electric puller fans. And, despite being a thoroughly massaged piece, the mean, green mill looks right at home in the truck's spotless, silver engine compartment.
DRIVETRAIN/SUSPENSION

One peek under this sweet pickup reveals solid bones that were built to cruise. Behind the 350, a green Turbo-Hydramatic 350 3-speed twists a tough 10-bolt axle. That first-rate drivetrain pushes a modern 4-link suspension. Tracking is provided by an independent front-half, which features modern power steering. Braking is equally class, with a floor mounted booster charging green calipers and drums. Coated Hedman Hedders dump spent gases in to 2.5-inch pipes, which breathe through throaty Flowmaster mufflers. As with the truck's body and engine, detailing is on point, with a stainless fuel tank and polished oil pan complementing a polished flywheel shied and polished transmission pan. And power meets the pavement through chromed Panther Juices, which twist 225/35ZR18 BF Goodrich g-Force T/As in front of 285/30ZR20 BF Goodrich g-Force T/As.
INTERIOR

Pop this Chevy's electronic doors and you'll find a completely custom interior that blends hot paint and custom flamework with custom leather and suede trim. Front and center, a smoothed dash seats green-lit Dakota Digital telemetry above components for Southern Air climate control. Opposite that dash, modern bucket seats stretch tight hides around fluid power adjustment. Between those seats, a custom console centers a Hurst Pro-Matic shifter behind modern JVC audio. At the bottom of that console, leather sills frame lit carpet, which rides under billet foot pedals. At the edges of that carpet, tailored door panels prop billet handles in front of fluid power windows. And the driver stays connected to the road through a fully polished steering wheel that laps a polished, titling column.
OUR SALE INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTATION AND ACCESSORIES
Build photos
Build receipts
Component literature
Spare paint
Two sets of keys

If you're looking for a unique classic that mixes a great restoration with unmatched style and instant fun, this 3100 deserves your full attention. It's spectacular from every angle. It plays to a level of nostalgia that everyone can appreciate. And, whether you're setting up at a show or just spending Saturday afternoon on the town, it's guaranteed to be the center of attention!

The beneficiary of a ground-up restoration that was completed in 2005 / Winner of multiple awards
350 cubic inch Chevrolet V8 / Weiand 142 supercharger / 515 horsepower

Custom leather and suede interior / Southern Air conditioning / Modern audio

Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1956 Chevrolet 3100.
HISTORY

The Chevrolet Task Force was Chevrolet's successor to the Advance Design trucks. The Task Force Series ran from late 1955 (second series) through 1959. At GMC locations, it was called the Blue Chip Series. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA
SPECIFICS / BUILD INFORMATION
EXTERIOR

CLASSIC CAR RESTORATIONS:

The term "restoration" in context to the vintage car world has taken on a definition of its own. For some people, a restoration is simply painting a car and replacing items as needed, while for others, restoration means an extensive disassembly and overhaul, with each piece getting rebuilt or replaced.

As a consumer, it's important to understand the basics of restoration levels for it can impact classic car values substantially. There are hundreds of ways to restore a vintage car or truck including but not limited to the following: i).
Frame off restoration.
Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly. ii).
Rotisserie restoration.

These restorations are when the body (or body and frame on a unibody vehicle) are disassembled and restored utilizing a rotisserie. Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly and iii).
Cosmetic or driver quality restoration.

These restoration are typically limited to cosmetic items including paint and body, interior, trim and emblems, etc. Within the three levels or restoration mentioned above, there can be varying quality from an in the garage / amateur restoration to a high dollar professional concours restoration. There is a universal 100 point grading system rating classic car conditions ranging from 100 being excellent to 20 being unrestorable.
In addition to the levels of restoration above, it's important to understand the type of restoration as well for it can also impact value substantially. Type of restorations include: i).
Factory or stock restoration.

This type of restoration is geared towards restoring the car or truck to stock specs from the factory as if it were new. These types of restorations use original or oem (original equipment manufacturer) where possible. Factory original restorations tend to bring the highest dollars from collectors. ii).
Custom restoration.

These types of restorations are geared towards builder preference over factory stock. These can be refereed to as customs or hot rods. Typically these vehicles will have custom paint work, aftermarket wheels, suspension upgrades, power plant transplants, etc. A specific sector of custom restoration vehicles is pro-touring or restomod / restomods which are custom built with a more modern street performance and creature comforts than the original factory vehicle.
Please note that WWVA is not a restoration shop nor do we restore vehicles to any degree.
For questions on what type or level of restoration of any of our vehicles in inventory please call our vintage sales expert today at 1-877-422-2940.

We do not recommend driving a classic car home. Many classic cars are not driven often and tend to sit for long periods of time making them unsuitable for cross-country road trips. We strongly recommend shipping the vehicle.

We sell our vehicles mileage-exempt, meaning we do not know the actual, original miles. The information listed in the ad is based on the current odometer reading or from rebuild information provided by the builder, and cannot be used as fact.
Most of these vehicles do not have Carfax or Autocheck history reports; unless the vehicle is 1981 or newer, a Carfax or Autocheck history will not exist.

It is powered by a 350 CID V8 with the company of a 3-speed automatic transmission. This truck is a very nice driver it starts right up with no issue and brakes straight and drives straight as well. The exterior of this truck is in great condition. It has a very clean red paint with a very nicely executed bed that is a mix of metal and wood. The wood has been stained evenly throughout the bed and has a matching luggage box stacked on top. This is one truck that was truly built to catch peoples eye going down the road. You will notice the exhaust runs straight out the back through a solid piece of diamond plate aluminum. The wheels mesh perfectly with this truck with the chrome and red lines that match the body of the truck. The tires have plenty of tread life in them and ready to hit the road and take you to your next local car meet. Moving to the interior you will find it is in great condition. The grey leather bench seat is in like new condition with the door panels to match.
